intro: Thrincia pilosiuscula, commonly known as the woolly thrincia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small shrub that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features small, pale green leaves covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and appear in clusters during the warmer months. Thrincia pilosiuscula is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
